69b301143beca31e76cf7bfdbd4d5537 (23:08): so is this HTML Reunification post suggesting that libraries will implement namespace support in JavaScript?
69b301143beca31e76cf7bfdbd4d5537 (23:08): including looking for and handling xmlns attributes?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:08): 69b301143beca31e76cf7bfdbd4d5537: so it seems
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:09): wait what? that's the most ridiculous thing i've heard all day. Who suggested that?

69b301143beca31e76cf7bfdbd4d5537 (23:10): I'm trying to make sense of the paragraph that contains " Since HTML parsers are unaware of xmlns attributes, it is entirely too dangerous to encourage the use of default namespaces in conformant HTML."
69b301143beca31e76cf7bfdbd4d5537 (23:10): that's the only interpretation I've considered that makes that make any sense, but I'm probably misunderstanding the whole post
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:11): what does that even mean
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:11): who wrote this? is this a lastweek crazy post or something?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:11): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: http://intertwingly.net/blog/2009/04/08/HTML-Reunification#c1239205696
69b301143beca31e76cf7bfdbd4d5537 (23:12): "libraries that operate on the resulting DOM will consistently evaluate namespaces after the reparenting operation."
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:12): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Mr. Last Week homed in on the crux of Sam's post: the gatekeeper and king maker sentence
69b301143beca31e76cf7bfdbd4d5537 (23:12): as far as I can tell, the idea as that we can shoe-horn in distributed extensibility by just treating names with colons transparently
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:13): oh, it's a blog post
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:13): comment i mean
69b301143beca31e76cf7bfdbd4d5537 (23:13): and then I guess the idea is that JS libraries will implement something like Namespaces in XML at a layer above that
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:13): sam gets lots of people commenting crazy stuff on his blog, i wouldn't pay much attention to them
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:14): (i didn't look to see who wrote the comment)
